GYS Documentation

Homepage at gys.sourceforge.net

Introduction

GYS is the free scripting engine which helps to create the embedded interpreter of your own language.

The interpreter can be called within application to execute the script according to the designed language definition and functionality. Developer can define next language elements:

  • types
  • operators (binary, prefix and postfix unary)
  • conversions between values of different types
  • built-in functions (commands)

Mainly this library can be used to create:

  • embedded scripting language for your application
  • standalone interpreter of your own language

Interpreter

GYS has built-in lexical and expression analyzer, but during interpretation it calls different user code for executing commands, operators, conversions and value getting. The interpreter is fully runtime - it reads code and interprets it at once. It doesn't generate any intermediate code.

Restrictions

Some language definition elements are built-in and can't be changed by user yet:
  • expression evaluator
  • operators' token set and precedence in expressions
  • lexical analyzer
